result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew M. Metzdorf

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:03 am - DA calls cases 16CF57, 16CM51, 16CM84 and 16CF71 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Mathew M. Metzdorf appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CF71 does not have a preliminary hearing.  DE reads preliminary hearing waiver form and signs.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court accepts waiver.  Court questions DE regarding right to attorney.  DE waives attorney.  Information filed, acknowledged, and reading is waived.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Case 16CM51 and 16CF71.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on those two cases, and on motion of DA, dismisses but reads in 16CM84 for purposes of restitution, and dismisses 16CF57 in its entirety. DA certifies victims right compliance.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

16CM51 - Sentence withheld - 1 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$200 DNAAS
$100 DOMAB
30 days jail with huber cs to 16CF71 and any other sentence now in being and is to commence within 30 days of 12/8/16 with continued obedience to bond and with the approval of the probation agent
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.  
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group  
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.

16CF71 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$250 DNAAS
45 days jail with huber cs to 16CM51 and any other sentence now in being and is to commence within 30 days of 12/8/16 with continued obedience to bond and with the approval of the probation agent
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.  
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims  in 16CF57 in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group  

16CM84 is DRI
$550 restitution + $55 for a total of $605 to Jack Dobson as condition of probation in 16CF71

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mathew M. Metzdorf
Current: 800 Cherry Street, Lot 308, Prentice, WI 54556 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2016)
Prior: 290 Center Avenue, Phillips, WI 54555

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Kaitlyn Cress, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

Cases 16CM84 and 16CF57.  Defendant Mathew M. Metzdorf appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to 16CM84.  Time limits waived on 16CF57.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  $150 CB has been forfeited and DA asks that a new SB bond be set on this case (16CM84).
State's - & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence
